tasks.name_english: Industrial heat supply up to max. 200°C

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Industrielle Wärmeversorgung für Temperaturbedarfe von 200 °C bis maximal 500 °C für industrielle Prozesse meist auf Dampfbasis
tasks.name_english: Industrial heat supply for temperature needs of 200 °C to a maximum of 500 °C for industrial processes usually on steam basis

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Industrieller Wärmebedarf (feste Brennstoffe oder Strom) mit einem Temperaturniveau höher als 500 °C bis über 1500°C ohne Reduktionsmittelanforderung
tasks.name_english: Industrial heat demand (solid fuels or electricity) with a temperature level higher than 500 °C up to more than 1500°C without reduction agent requirement

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Gasförmiger Industrieller Wärmebedarf mit einem Temperaturneiveau höher als 500 °C
tasks.name_english: Gaseous industrial heat demand with a temperature level higher than 500 °C

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Einfamilienhäuser mit bester verfügbarer Dämmung (Alt- und Neubauten): Erd- oder Wandheizung oder direkte Luftheizung (niedrige Heiztemperatur); Warmwasserenergiebedarf hoch im Verhältnis zum Raumwärmebedarf
tasks.name_english: Single family houses with best available insulation (old and new buildings): ground or wall heating system or direct air heating (low heating temperature); hot water energy demand high in relation to room heat demand

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Ein- und Zweifamilienhäuser aller Altersgruppen (Altbau) und alte Mehrfamilienhäuser mit Passivhausstandard; mittlerer Energiebedarf; i.d.R. keine Fußboden- oder Wandheizung, d.h. mindestens 45 °C Vorlauftemperatur; Neubauten mit Fußbodenheizung und 30-70°C Puffer; ca. 22% Warmwasseranteil am Wärmebedarf
tasks.name_english: One- and two-family houses of all age groups (old building) and old apartment buildings with passive house standard; average energy requirement; generally no underfloor or wall heating, i.e. at least 45 °C in flow temperature; new buildings with underfloor heating and 30-70°C buffer; around 22% hot water share of heat requirement

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Ein- und Zweifamilienhäuser aller Altersgruppen (Neu- und Altbau) mit einem Energiebedarf von 60 bis 120 kWh/m²; mittlerer Energiebedarf; Fußboden- oder Radiatorenheizung, d.h. Vorlauf mindestens 45 °C; überwiegend Neubauten mit Fußbodenheizung und 30-70°C-Puffer; ca. 14-26% Warmwasseranteil am Wärmebedarf
tasks.name_english: One- and two-family houses of all age groups (new and old buildings) with an energy requirement of 60 to 120 kWh/m²; average energy requirement; underfloor or radiator heating, i.e. pre-flow at least 45 °C; mostly new constructions with underfloor heating and 30-70°C buffer; approx. 14-26% hot water share of heat requirement

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Verschiedene Ein- und Zweifamilienhäuser mit einem Heizleistungsbedarf von 10,5 kW: eher mittlere und ältere Jahrgänge mit einem Energiebedarf von 120 bis 180 kWh/m² (eher unsaniert oder teilsaniert); alle Heizungsanlagen im Haus, d. h. Vorlauf mindestens 60 °C; Puffer; je nach Gebäudetyp ca. 10-40 % Warmwasseranteil am Wärmebedarf; 1700 - 2400 Volllaststunden pro Jahr
tasks.name_english: Various one- and two-family houses  with a heating power requirement of 10.5 kW: rather medium and older age groups with an energy requirement of 120 to 180 kWh/m² (rather unrenovated or partly renovated); all heating systems in the house, i.e. pre-flow at least 60 °C; buffer; around 10-40% hot water share of heat requirement depending on building type; 1700 - 2400 full load hours a year

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Diverse Wohngebäude mit einem Heizleistungsbedarf von 14,9 kW: überwiegend Altbau; Ein- und Zweifamilienhäuser hohen und mittleren Alters unsaniert mit einem spezifischen Energiebedarf von mehr als 180 kWh/m², sowie Mehrfamilienhäuser mit mittlerem Energiebedarf und große Mehrfamilienhäuser mit sehr geringem spezifischem Heizbedarf; Vorlauf in der Regel mindestens 75 °C; Puffer; ca. 8-18% Warmwasseranteil am Heizbedarf; 1600-1850 Volllaststunden pro Jahr
tasks.name_english: Various residential buildings with a heating capacity requirement of 14.9 kW: mainly old buildings; one- and two-family houses of high and medium age unrenovated with a specific energy requirement of more than 180 kWh/m², as well as multi-family houses with medium energy requirements and large multi-family houses with a very low specific heating requirement; pre-flow usually at least 75 °C; buffer; approx. 8-18% hot water share of heating requirement; 1600-1850 full load hours per year

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Mittelgroße Mehrfamilienhäuser mittleren Alters mit mittlerem spezifischem Wärmebedarf, daneben eine Vielzahl anderer Wohngebäude mit ähnlichen Eigenschaften. Vorlauftemperatur der Heizungsanlage tendenziell mindestens 75°C, Warmwasseranteil im Bereich von 10 bis 25%; 1850 bis 1900 Volllaststunden
tasks.name_english: Medium-sized, middle-aged multi-family houses with medium specific heat demand, in addition to a variety of other residential buildings with similar characteristics. Heating systems pre-flow temperature tends to be at least 75°C, proportion of domestic hot water in the range of 10 to 25%; 1850 to 1900 full load hours

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Große Mehrfamilienhäuser mittleren und höheren Alters mit mittlerem bis hohem spezifischem Wärmebedarf, Heizungsvorlauf tendenziell mindestens 75 bis 85°C, Warmwasseranteil ca. 18 %.
tasks.name_english: Large middle-aged and old multi-family houses with medium to high specific heat requirements, heating systems pre-flow tending to be at least 75 to 85°C, proportion of domestic hot water approx. 18 %.

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Gut sanierte große mittelgroße Mehrfamilienhäuser; ein durchschnittlicher Energiebedarf von 92 MWh; in der Regel reduzierte Vorlauftemperatur von maximal 70 °C für Heizung; 18 - 29 % Warmwasserbereitung
tasks.name_english: Well-renovated large medium-sized multi-family houses; an average energy requirement of 92 MWh; generally reduced pre-flow temperature of maximum 70 °C for heating; 18 - 29% domestic hot water

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Ältere gemischte Wohngebäude und diverse Nichtwohngebäude (überwiegend Halbtagsnutzung) mit einem Wärmeleistungsbedarf von ca. 25 kW und einem Vollnutzungsgrad von ca. 1900 h/a; Heizungsanlagen mit Vorlauf im Bereich 75 - 85°C; Warmwasserbedarf 16-19 %.
tasks.name_english: Older mixed residential buildings and various non-residential buildings (mainly half-day usage) with a thermal power requirement of around 25 kW and a full utilisation rate of around 1900 h/a; heating systems with pre-flow in the 75 - 85°C range; domestic hot water requirement 16-19%

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Neue Nichtwohngebäude mit geringem spezifischen Energiebedarf bei ganztägiger Nutzung (ca. 3300 Volllaststunden pro Jahr) und hohem Warmwasseranteil 45-50% (70°C)
tasks.name_english: New non-residential buildings with low specific energy requirements for full-day use (approx. 3300 full load hours a year) and high domestic hot water proportion 45-50% (70°C)

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Ältere Nichtwohngebäude im Ganztagsbetrieb (ca. 3000 Volllastbetriebsstunden pro Jahr) und sehr hohem Warmwasseranteil von 43-50%, aber häufig mit eher geringem spezifischen Wärmebedarf; Wasservorlauf meist 75-85°C
tasks.name_english: Older non-residential buildings in full-day use (approx. 3000 full load operation hours per year) and very high hot water proportion of 43-50%, but frequently with rather low specific heat requirement; water pre-flow usually 75-85°C

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Halbtagsnutzung und gewerbliche Nutzung von Nicht-Wohngebäuden, die nach 1983 errichtet und wenig saniert wurden; durchschnittlicher Energiebedarf; verschiedene Heizsysteme (Heizkörper, Deckenradiatoren, Warmluftgebläse), d.h. Vorlauf mindestens 50 - 60 °C, teilweise deutlich höher; ca. 1600 Volllastbetriebsstunden pro Jahr; Warmwasserbedarf <20%
tasks.name_english: Half-day use and commercial use of non-residential buildings constructed after 1983 and little renovated; average energy requirement; various heating systems (radiators, ceiling radiators, hot-air blowers), i.e. pre-flow at least 50 - 60 °C, in some cases significantly higher; approx. 1600 full load operation hours per year; hot water requirement <20%

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Altes Nichtwohngebäude mit Halbtagsnutzung und hohem spezifischem Energiebedarf, sowie diverse alte Sondernutzungsformen (Nichtwohngebäude), Volllastbetriebsstunden pro Jahr unter 1900 und Warmwasseranteil unter 20%; Vorlauf 75-85°C
tasks.name_english: Old non-residential building with half-day use and high specific energy requirement, as well as various old special forms of use (non-residential), full load operation hours per year below 1900 and hot water proportion below 20%; pre-flow 75-85°C

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Alte Nichtwohn-Sondergebäude mit hohem spezifischem Energiebedarf und geringen Volllastbetriebsstunden pro Jahr (<1700) und Warmwasseranteil unter 13%; Vorlauf 75 bis 85°C
tasks.name_english: Old non-residential special buildings with high specific energy requirement and low full loap operation hours per year (<1700) and hot water share below 13%; pre-flow 75 to 85°C

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.

tasks.name_german: Fernwärmeversorgung aus Biomasse (sehr vereinfacht - großflächig ohne Änderung der Netzstrukturen); dieser Teilbereich der Wärmeversorgung ist nur ein "Platzhalter" für intensivere Forschung in diesem Bereich
tasks.name_english: District heating supply from biomass (very simplified - large-scale without changing the network structures); this subsector of heat supply is just a "place holder" for more intensive research in this field

reference.source: Lenz et al. (2019): Technical and economic data of renewable heat supply systems for different heat sub-sectors.
